results.title: Giant turtles
results.brief_description: Shows sea turtles coming ashore by night to lay their eggs before returning to the water. Also shows the hatching of the baby turtles two months later and their instinctive race for the water.

results.title: Giant molecules (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Demonstrates addition and condensation polymerization reactions, and indicates how physical properties and molecular shape of polymers may be related. Four polymers are shown, and the differences in their properties are explained using models. Finally, materials are shown being turned into the more familiar plastic consumer goods.

results.title: Giant in the sun
results.creator_credit: Northern Nigeria Information Services, Victor M. Gover and Sidney Samuelson
results.brief_description: This film discusses the land and people of northern Nigeria. It covers the ancient cities of Kano, Sokoto, Ilorin and Katsina, with the dazzling spectacle of the Sallah, presided over by the Emir. Shows traditional crafts flourishing alongside modern developments in industry, education, health and welfare. (Award: Grand Award at the Third African Film Festival, 1959).

results.title: Giant devil dingo
results.creator_credit: Weston Woods Studios and Morton Schindel
results.brief_description: Dick Roughsey’s story of Gaiya, a dingo which once roamed the Australian bush killing people for food, is told to the accompaniment of didgeridoos.

results.title: Giant bears of Kodiak island
results.creator_credit: National Geographic Society and Wolfgang Bayer
results.brief_description: The great Kodiak bear is the largest carnivore to roam the Earth. Living on Alaska’s Kodiak Island, the bear roams the jagged coastlines and 4,000 foot mountains as part of their territory. This program captures the bears hunting, fishing, and teaching their young survival skills. As portions of the island become development targets, the contact between bear and human becomes more frequent. Compelling footage will have viewers spellbound.

results.title: Giant
results.brief_description: A film of staggering scale and grandeur in which cattleman Bick Benedict (Rock Hudson), his society-gilded wife Leslie (Elizabeth Taylor) and three generations of land-rich Texas sons and daughters love, swagger, connive, and clash in a monumental drama of family strife, racial bigotry and conflict between cattle barons and newly-rich oil tycoons. George Stevens received his second Academy Award for Best Director and the film also received nine other Oscar nominations. James Dean’s portrayal of the sulking, cackling wrangler Jett Rink is perhaps the most significant of the stellar performances because it was his very last. Also stars Mercedes McCambridge, Dennis Hopper and Sal Mineo. A truly unforgettable experience, “Giant” not only lives up to its name, but surpasses it by far. Based on the novel by Edna Ferber.

results.title: Ghosts of the civil dead [DVD] (D)
results.creator_credit: Correctional Services, Outlaw Values, Evan English and John Hillcoat
results.brief_description: Shattering experience set in an imaginary prison institution somewhere in the not too distant future. A crammed prison is the breeding ground for violence, drug trafficking and homosexual sadism. Authorities allow it all to breed in order to justify retaliatory crackdowns, in an escalating spiral of violence. The end product discharged from the institution is a new breed of social, disruptive misfits. Cast includes David Field, Mike Bishop, Chris DeRose, Kevin Mackey, Dave Mason, Nick Cave, Vincent Gil.

results.title: Ghosts of Mars (Collector's edition)
results.creator_credit: Screen Gems, Sandy King and John Carpenter
results.brief_description: In 2176 AD humans have been colonizing and mining the planet Mars for years. It is still a desolate place, a matriarchal society populated by 640,000 colonists and protected by the Mars Police Force (MPF). The film is told in flashback by head strong, drug addicted Lieutenant Melanie Ballard (Natasha Henstridge), who is found hand cuffed to an unmanned train that returns to camp minus its crew. Ballard was part of a MPF troupe enlisted to transfer prisoner James “Desolation” Williams (Ice Cube) from Shining Canyon to Chryse City. When they reach their destination however, Ballard and her fellow crew members: Commander Braddock (Pam Grier), Butler (Jason Statham), Kincaid (Clea DuVall) and Uno (Liam Waite), find the place abandoned and everyone dead, hung upside down and decapitated, a crime with which Williams has been accused in the past but has an alibi for this time. Closer inspection reveals the survival of not only Williams, but also Doctor Arlene Whitlock, 2 other prisoners, and a growing posse of possessed “creatures”, original inhabitants of the planet whose ghosts escaped when Whitlock opened Pandora’s Box. Police and prisoners band together to fight an enemy of Martian spirits against a bleak and blood stained backdrop (shot on location on a gypsum mine near Albuquerque, New Mexico), an industrial soundtrack blasting in the background.

results.title: Ghosts of a river
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Pierre Patry and Jacques Kasma
results.brief_description: Looks at the Columbia River as a wild and untamed stream coursing through its beautiful mountain region, sparsely populated but replete with history. Many of the old shot towns and abandoned mines, destined to extinction due to plans for a giant hydro-electric scheme which would transform the whole valley, are shown.

results.title: Ghostbusters (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Bill Murray, Dan Aykroyd and Harold Ramis star as the freelance crusaders who team up as the Ghostbusters Squad. Armed with ectoplasmic swats and patented booby traps, they walk a fine line between scientific genius and lunacy in their quest to rid the city of slimy, haunting monsters on the rampage in New York.
